resources.string: Application is subscribed to hardware watchdog service.
Application is subscribed to software watchdog service.
Application is not subscribed to watchdog service.

The hardware watchdog service is used to detect system malfunctions and perform a reboot in that case. During normal operation, the hardware watchdog service regularly restarts the watchdog timer to prevent it from elapsing. If, due to a hardware or software error, the service is not able to update the hardware watchdog, the system will automatically reboot.\n\nApplications are also able to subscribe to the hardware watchdog service. If a subscribed application reports failure to the watchdog service, system will automatically reboot.

The watchdog service allows applications to subscribe to it in order to check application integrity in a time basis. Users can configure the time interval at which watchdog service will ask application for status. Additionally, the watchdog service offers two different subscription types:

 - Hardware Watchdog
 - Software watchdog

Check their meaning below.
When an application is subscribed to the hardware watchdog service, the device will reboot the system when malfunction is detected in the subscribed application

When an application is subscribed to the software watchdog service, the device will stop the subscribed application when malfunction is detected and the passed PendingIntent will be executed (if any).\n\nIn this case, the application will be restarted if the \'Restart application\' check box is selected.
